fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8304].
  {panel}

When using national characters in reporters or assignees, the sorting doesn't work, as I suggested. The names with national characters are pushed to end of list, that is wrong.

Current bahaviour - sorting by reporter:

* Lízner Lukáš
* Novák Karel
* Zima Oldřich
* Čedík Pavel
* Šaršon Jindřich

Correct behaviour with correct czech ordering should be:

* Čedík Pavel
* Lízner Lukáš
* Novák Karel
* Šaršon Jindřich
* Zima Oldřich

I suggest to create new field in admin, where I be able to specify, which locales I want to use for sorting, as Collator class do.
fields.summary: Sorting in issue list doesn't respect locale settings
Ability for global ownerity of filters (or at least changing the filter owner)

fields.description: Currently if there is no calendar_LANG.js file for the locale you will get js errors. This should not happen.
fields.summary: If there is no calendar translation for language make sure jira does not show the calendar popup

It's not catastrophic since searching for projects & issue types that are invalid will simply return no results

Entity "SearchRequest" has field "request" of type "very-long"
Needs to be "extremely-long" for import into Oracle as standalone instance seemed to allow longer content length than 4000 characters.  (that whole clob thing)

Throws:
ORA-01461: can bind a LONG value only for insert into a LONG column

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8292].
  {panel}

Hi,

in our workflow, there's a validation step after creating and before resolving. 1. open, 2. valid, 3.in progress,...
It will be interesting to avoid this step for the users who don't need to be valid :
a validation for the customers, not for the actors of the projects...

It could be a post-function which transform the status open in valid if the actor of the transition belongs to leader, developers,...

Is-it possible to do something like that or what do you recommend?

Thank's

Anne
fields.summary: Multiple initial transitions (eg. "Open", "Open & Validate" buttons on Create Issue)

it could be interesting to transform an issue into a subtask of another one.

Thank's

it will be good if subtask don't appear directly in the issue navigator, if we can access a subtask only by her mother. So, there are less issues in the navigator...
is-it possible?

Thank's

Anne

fields.description:
That's not really a bug, it's a choice, but....

I was looking for a solution, with JIRA, to put side (not delete) old closed issues. For our compagny, issues don't have to be deleted.
But, with the passing of years, there's a lot of issues, and the database becomes bigger & bigger.
Bulk move was a good solution for that, but in moving, the issue change his id (PKEY in database). It's a pity because the users knows their issue with the id... So, we can't use this functionnality.

Is it a problem for you to keep the old name?

For example, I have 2 project : A and B.
I have 3 issues in A : A1, A2,A3

            2 in B : B1, B2

If I move A3 to B, the issue keeps his name. And the next one in A take A4 for name, the next one in B, B3 or B4 :
A : A1, A2
B : B1, B2, A3

If it's a problem, is it possible to show a column with the real ID in database (which don't change)...

Thank's for your help.
fields.summary: Lost of issue's ID when moving from a project to another one

fields.description:
Hello,

Is there any way to customize the search menue? For example the order of  fields?

We have lots of custom fields in our project. So our SearchMenue is really long because every
custom-field is displayed and it would be nice to put important fields at the top of the search menue.

Holger
fields.summary: Create custom search menue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8286].
  {panel}

We had the partition which is used for Jira's indexes become full for about 10 minutes. During this time, Jira couldn't obviously correctly update the indexes which caused the indexes to go out of synch.

The issue here is that Jira continued to seem to run fine although it for example wasn't showing any new issues in return to filter queries due to the index problem.

Rebuilding the index corrected the issue.

Could you look into creating some form of a "dirty flag" for the index and set it in case the indexer has trouble saving the index files? Then notify the administrators somehow that there was trouble saving the index and ask them to rebuild.
fields.summary: Index corruption when server drives get full - Jira doesn't notice

fields.description: The 'Configuring JIRA' (configuration.xml) page hasn't been updated for some time and now includes some redundant options and is missing some new ones.
fields.summary: Update the 'Configuring JIRA'  page

fields.description:
The shortcut key for commenting on an issue "m" does not work twice.

I believe this has to do with 2 occurrences of 
{code}
accesskey="m"
{code}

on the page.
The first one shows the comment box, subsequent ones, try to give focus to the text box.
fields.summary: Shortcut key for commenting doesn't work twice

fields.description: We are using a notification scheme that should notify the assignee when an issue is assigned. This doesn't appear to be working consistently
fields.summary: Notifications inconsistent

fields.description:
We are using Jira for project planning and progress tracking. In addition to that we will use Jira to generate timesheets on a monthly base.  Therefore I played a bit with the timesheet report plugin (thanks to Jeff Turner :-) ). This is pretty cool and it will help to cover our needs.

But the restrictions
(A) have to enter the work log on the day I did the work (forgot to enter it at the EOB will do it at next day for prev day)
(B) could not enter work logs for colleagues (colleague forgot it and is ill or on vacation)
(C) could not edit work logs JRA-8281
results in less acceptance in our development teams.

(A) For the work log entry it should be possible to enter date of the work log as well. If the date is not maintained use the current date as default behaviour like it works right now.
(A) The user which did the work should also be part of an work log. At the moment  the current user will automatically combined with the work log. As default behaviour this is perfect. In addition to the default behaviour an administrative user  should have the option to enter in the name of a team member a work log to the project. Therefore a select box to which a project user could be selected would be perfect. 

(1) Is one of those feature covered in one of the latest releases or in the enterprise version?
(2) Are such features somehow planned for further release?
(3) Is it possible to add such a functionality to one of the plugin interfaces (release)?

We would appreciate any idea how we could solve those requirements.
fields.summary: Work log entry together with worklog date or for other users

fields.description:
We using Jira extensive even for project planning and progress tracking. If you accidentally mistype your work log you have no chance to correct it. The entry of a too low value could be corrected but if you enter a too high value the tracking is completely wrong.
E.g. I will enter 2d and forget the d (day) this results in 2 minutes -> correction possible with an additional worklog 1d 7h 58m
I will enter 2h and accidentally enter 2d -> correction is not possible.

(1) Is this feature covered in one of the latest releases or in the enterprise version?
(2) Is such a feature somehow planned for further release?
(3) Is it possible to add such a functionality to one of the plugin interfaces (release)?
fields.summary: Worklog should be editable

fields.description: Copying a workflow and changing transition name (eg. "Start Progress" -> "Start") does not have any effect. When the edited workflow is activated, the link is still the old name ("Start Progress").
fields.summary: Renaming workflow transition has no effect

fields.description:
JIRA will not work on JBoss 4.0.0. It dies on startup with this error:

{noformat}
2005-10-18 15:32:54,466 DEBUG [tomcat.localhost./jira.Context]  Starting filter 'UrlRewriteFilter'
2005-10-18 15:32:54,716 ERROR [org.apache.commons.digester.Digester] Begin event threw exception
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: No ClassLoaders found for: org.tuckey.web.filters.urlrewrite.Rule
      at org.jboss.mx.loading.LoadMgr3.beginLoadTask(LoadMgr3.java:198)
      at org.jboss.mx.loading.RepositoryClassLoader.loadClassImpl(RepositoryClassLoader.java:463)
      at org.jboss.mx.loading.RepositoryClassLoader.loadClass(RepositoryClassLoader.java:374)
      at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:235)
      at org.apache.commons.digester.ObjectCreateRule.begin(ObjectCreateRule.java:252)
      at org.apache.commons.digester.Rule.begin(Rule.java:200)
      at org.apache.commons.digester.Digester.startElement(Digester.java:1273)
      at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.startElement(Unknown Source)
      at org.apache.xerces.impl.dtd.XMLDTDValidator.startElement(Unknown Source)
      at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanStartElement(Unknown Source)
{noformat}

Evidently the JBoss copy of Commons Digester is being used in preference to JIRA's (in violation of the servlet spec) and so Digester cannot see the org.tuckey.* classes in JIRA.

This is fixed in JBoss 4.0.1 and above, where JBoss switched to a saner classloading model.
fields.summary: JIRA 3.3 and above does not work on JBoss 4.0.0 due to classloader problems with urlrewrite filter

fields.description:
When adding additional watchers to an open JIRA issue, I found that when filtering the users to 100, then trying to get to the next page (users 101 and up) you can't.

I had to switch my filter back to 50 users, then click next, next to get to users 101 and up.

Nothing major in my opinion
fields.summary: Can't access beyond 100 users in User Picker when filter is set to display 100 users per page

fields.description:
When i configure my Jira installaiton to connect to de MySQL server i have the following problem. By first time starting the service all the tables are creating on the MySQL server and i can work.

But now when i stop the service (for example to reboot the server) an start it again, the connection to the database faild. When i connect with the Browser to the application i become the Apache Toncat/5.5.9 - Error Report:


HTTP Status 404 - /

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

type Status report

message /

description The requested resource (/) is not available.


Do someone have a resolution for this ?
fields.summary: JIRA 3.3.1 and MySQL, Problems after restarting the JIRA Tomcat Service

fields.description:
The permission system within JIRA seems to be based upon the idea that a lot of users are part of multiple projects with the same permission types. This results in the fact that users are linked to permission schemes instead of projects. In our situation and i believe for a lot of other people, users are linked to one or a few projects and should not be able to see or enter other projects. This means that users and/or groups should be linked to a project first. Permission schemes should be generic and able to be linked to a project. The combination of the members of a project and the assigned generic permission schemes to the project and its members assures which permissions project members within that project have. This approach prevents the definition of a lot of the same type of permission schemes and lots of different usergroups (read projectteams).

In other words, in my opion you should create permissions schemes as 'project roles' so you only have to create a few permissions schemes, link them to a project and then assign users to the permission schemes (project roles) within that project. This will prevent those users to be able to enter other projects because they are not linked to that scheme systemwide but only within a project.

Looking forward to your reply and/or comments.

Regards, Paul
fields.summary: Permission scheme system in JIRA inefficient

fields.description: At the momnet the en_UK language bundle has identical files to the default bundle. When users change proeprties in the default bundle if their locale is en_* the changes do not take effect as the English bundle overrides the default one. We do not need to en_UK bundle. All we need is to include the English language descriptor in the default language bundle so that users can still select "en_UK" from the Language drop down in teh admin section.
fields.summary: Remove en_UK langusge bundle

fields.description:
The problem is that the "now" date is actaully converted to the date in the view template. If the field is not shown than this conversion never occurs.

This is likely affecting Date Time fields as well.
fields.summary: The date custom field gets set to 01-01-01 if the default value is "now" and the field does not appear on the issue creation screen

fields.description:
Rethink the search return count for Manage Filters screen

The _Manage Filters_ screen currently displays the count for each search filters. While the individual searches may not take a long time, getting a count for all filters when you have numerous filters is a real problem. In JIRA data with user {{mark@atlassian.com}}, you usually can't get to the manage filter screen since the page times out. My guess is that the coutn is causing this (unconfirmed).

If the problem can is confirmed, we should either remove the count or Ajaxify the counting. The page will load much quicker and the count information will still be available
fields.summary: Rethink the search return count for Manage Filters screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8262].
  {panel}

We have Confluence, we have Jira.
No matter how I poke around with the settings in JIRA, the look does not match Confluence (unless I use the default settings).
When I apply our color scheme, I still have various blue elements on screen.
Please unify the settings (and underlying markup) so that it is possible to use them in a consistent look wihtout having to touch most of the templates.
fields.summary: Please consolidate "look&feel" settings (color scheme) and unify with Confluence

fields.description:
We should have a message:

- if on XP, we should indicate that if you have problems - check that you haven't used XP's unzip tool
- if on solaris - indicate that if you see problems, check that you haven't used solaris' untar utility.

This can just be a simple message on startup - perhaps we can edit catalina.sh to add these messages?  Something like:

** We have detected you are running on Windows - if you see errors below, please see this URL:  http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/windows-troubleshooting.html **

Cheers,
Scott
fields.summary: Need to have JIRA indicate common install problems

fields.description:
The links to JIRA documentation, pointing to http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs, fail with a 404 File Not Found.

An example can be seen at http://www.atlassian.com/support/default.jsp, select JIRA documentation.
fields.summary: Links to JIRA documentation fail

fields.description: Instead of using Attachments, what is the syntax for referring to a file via a link (html or other) that exists on our local server?
fields.summary: Document creating links to files on network shares in wiki help.

fields.description: Descriptions (this text) does not show up when viewing issues or getting XML or editing issues. The only time it actually does show up is if you "configure issue navigator" and add the Description column to your view.
fields.summary: Descriptions do not show up correctly.

fields.description:
In the text of the bug (the bug was imported from Bugzilla, but I do not think it's relevant) there's a text:

SU-18_0.2005.........

It happens that I have a project with key "SU" and the project has an issue 18.  So Jira shows this SU-18 as a link, which I think is not correct: the undescore after the number should suggest that the string SU-18 is a part of a long string.
fields.summary: Text in comments is incorrectly converted into links

fields.description:
1) make any new filter
2) in the issue navigator, add de enviroment field (this is not by default)
3) order by enviroment

Result: jira shows a message telling that jira must be reindexed (but after reindexing jira, the problem continues)
fields.summary: sorting by "enviroment" on issue navigator

fields.description:
Hi *,
In our environment, all projects follow the same calendar, with the same Versions.  (we use Versions for Releases)
An identical set of Versions for the next few years has been entered manually in Jira for all projects individually.
Now, to produce a report that shows all issues fixed in a particular Version (for all projects), I cannot filter on the version information when "All projects" is selected.
I feel this is very unfortunate.
What do you think about this?
Thx
J.
fields.summary: Filter on Version information accross Projects

fields.description:
Single Level Group By report quite ugly

There seems to be excess padding everywhere and the percentage bar graph looks bloated
fields.summary: Single Level Group By report quite ugly

fields.description:
Each project has different versions and components and therefore when moving issues between projects the versions and components will always be changed. We can make this option a bit more smart by letting JIRA check the version name and then change the versions and components based on name if the retain checkbox has been set.

This gets tricky if more than one version/component has been selected on the issue, and a match is found for one of the selected versions/components. In this case should we:
a) remove the version/component that does not have a version/component with the same name in the destination project
b) remove the invalid version/component and replace it with the option entered by the user. In this case the values that do have a matching mapping in the destination project based on name will be kept
c) completely replace the values with the ones entered during move.
fields.summary: Retain values checkbox for Bulk Move should preserve versions or components based on version and components names

fields.description:
In the issue navigator, we have a section called "Project Components", which contains not only project components, but also fix-for/affects version. Evidently "component" is used here as a generic term, which is confusing.

We should rename this section to "Components/Versions" or something.
fields.summary: Poorly named issue navigator section

fields.description:
The Group By report is giving incorrect results. For example, here is a screenshot showing incorrect results for a second subtask type (only one issue validly belongs to type subtask2:

!groupby.png!

In other cases, some issue types don't appear at all.
fields.summary: Group By (Issue type) report broken

fields.description: I know this is an improvement, but we need to do this as a lot of users are complaining!
fields.summary: Note that single e-mail address is only useful for anonymously visible issues

fields.description: After installing JIRA, the 'Cache Issues' setting is set to On, while the description of that setting notes that "this should always be left off, unless explicitly asked to change the value by Atlassian support".

fields.description:
* seen *on jira.atlassian.com*
** printable version of an issue doesn't change the page "layout"
** printable version is not rendered at all

* on my *test installation*
** printable version of an issue throw javascript exception "object expected" in source pincomments.js on line 45   //	if (readCookie(sSectionID) == "on") //
** printable version is rendered...
fields.summary: Problems with printable version of an issue

fields.description:
Just started using Jira. After the better part of a week trying to resolve a support ticket (JSP-2732) it turns out my problem is:

Jeff Turner commented on JSP-2732:
----------------------------------

Thanks. The problem is that you have a newline characters in your XML:

        <property
         name="java.naming.factory.initial">com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtxFactory
        </property>

That needs to be:

        <property
         name="java.naming.factory.initial">com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtxFactory</property>

----

Sure enough, that fixed it. The Java hackers in my group saw the config and thought nothing of the whitespace. They are all a little suprised by the final solution.

If this can not be fixed for some reason, the documentation should get a nice big **WARNING, whitespace is relevant. Do not try to make this look pretty.**
fields.summary: whitespace should not be relevant in XML config

fields.description: Normally, when I return ro Search, the query will re-perform the search and reset the return to search issue count. I notice it is no longer doing that on your support site, as per screenshots. I was viewing issues from a search, and then did return to Search which redisplayed based on the up to date values, placing issue 6712 as most recently viewed. but when I click on the link, it tells me I am at issue 119 of 180 instead of 1 of 178.
fields.summary: Issue index messed up

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8236].
  {panel}

Please parse reply emails and remove Jira history content. Something like: if the email subject contains a Jira project key
then look at the content and delete anything below the first email header that contains that key.

We use Jira to track field issues and provide field support. 
1. Field staffer creates a Jira issue (either directly or via email). 
2. Support staff in head office make a comment in Jira. 
3. Field staffer receives a notification email containing the comment. 
5. Field staffer then typically replies "with history". 
6. Their reply with all of its history is added as one Jira comment, but that same history is already tracked (in a much nicer way) through individual Jira comments. This adds accumulated redundant information for each emailed reply "with history". After only a few replies such a Jira issue is very difficult to read, to the point of being counter-productive.

Field staff prefer email over Jira web access because they travel alot and don't always have access to the internet. But they do have access to a local replica of their email database on their laptops. This means they can work offline and respond to our questions straight after leaving a customer site (on a plane or train) while vital new information is fresh.

We have asked field staff to reply "without history" but this never works. They want to see what they're replying to and they always want to cc other staff in regional offices who have more access to internet and can "watch" issues.
fields.summary: Remove previous Jira history from the content of incoming emails (which are replies to Jira notifications)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8235].
  {panel}

Would it be possible instead of check box not check to send to the new user from LDAP send email to him but without password created?
I think this user should be notified about this action that he has access to the JIRA.
Thank you

Vladimír Skrbek

tel. +420 225 661 055
fields.summary: send email (without password) to new user even if it is from LDAP

fields.description:
I test Jira on local computer. We setup LDAP.
This list:
- I create new user in LDAP.
- I logout administrator and login as a new user, it is OK
- I logout user and login administrator
- I delete the new user
- then I try to add the same user with the same parameters, the Jira tels me that the user already exists.

See the attachment

The solution is to restart Appache service, but it is not so good solutions.
Thank you for repairing.

Vladimír Skrbek
Česká spořitelna, a.s.
Testovací kompetenční centrum
Želetavská 1448/7, Praha4, 140 00
tel. +420 225 661 055

fields.description:
Manage attachements page.

Deleteing issue attachment is a "dangerous" action. It is possible occasional deleting of attachement by just single click.

Please add confirmation dialog.

fields.description:
If I remove the "Browse Projects" permission for a user group I'm not able to create new issues.

This is a requirement for us. We want to allow our customers to access Jira for entering and editing issues. The customer should only see his own issues. Issues he created or which are assigned to them. I could not figure out how to do this with Jira 3.0.3.
Is there an option to do this in the mentioned Jira version or a newer one.

I saw the security level select box on version 3.4. That's create and could also used to solve that issue.
fields.summary: Create New Issue crash without browse project permission

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8229].
  {panel}

We'd really like to accelerate the creation of "template" issues containing a standard set of sub-task "steps". Ie: this template here:

Task
   Concept Sketch
   Model
   Normal Map
   Skin
 
Would be done 50-100x, once for each art asset we're tracking. We have the high-level list and I want to accelerate the creation of these issues with their steps as sub-tasks. I was looking into doing this with Jelly tags (I can perl some XML that would describe what we want but I can't express "sub-task" with the existing set of jelly commands.
fields.summary: Enable Creation of Sub-Tasks via Jelly Tags

we have a project with many users being assignable (~300)
They belong to about 10 or so groups

We could realy do with either a cascade select, or an ajax narrow as you type solution.

Oh and BTW Love these wiki edit boxes...

fields.description:
Currenty the free text custom fields are limited to 80 chars be default in issue navigator view and not limited at all in Excel export.

The description field is not limited at all. 

Need to allow users to specify the max length of the limit in jira-application.properties file. The default shoudl be -1 - i.e. no limit. Then the description and all the text custom ffields should be limited by this property, if its set to a positive value.

Excel view should never limit the length, no matter whether the property is positive or not.
fields.summary: Inconsistency between displaying free text custom field and description in issue navigator results

fields.description:
When deleting a custom field select-list option, one is presented with a list of affected issues:

!^deleteoption.png!

At this point it would be useful to have a link to a search request which selects these issues, so they can be bulk edited.
fields.summary: Deleting CF option values: add link to a filter defining affected issue list

fields.description:
Excel export should map each issue into a *single* spreadsheet row.

Currently, exporting as Excel produces a highly formatted spreadsheet where each JIRA issue gets spread out over many spreadsheet rows.  JIRA merges cells to make it visually apparent that multiple spreadsheet rows are actually one JIRA issue.  I suppose that works fine as far as it goes, though it is 100% useless to me:

Here are some examples of things that produce split rows:
- if the Description field contains line breaks, it gets split into several rows
- if issue is attributed with multiple components, it gets split into rows

The current approach *breaks* the most basic spreadsheet capability--sorting the issues.  I don't export to Excel because I want to look at a pretty report.  I export to Excel because I want to sort, characterize, and generally futz with the issues in ways that I cannot do (and don't expect to do) in JIRA.  The current approach is absolutely useless to me.  In fact, it adds negative value because I had to write an extensive VB macro to massage the default output into something usable.

Suggested behavior:
- Allow user the option of simple .csv or .xls export where each JIRA issue is mapped to a *single* spreadsheet row.
- For possibly compound fields like Component, concatenate mutliple values using user-selected intra-cell delimeter
fields.summary: Excel export should map each issue into a *single* spreadsheet row

fields.description:
When exporting issues as XML, export is limited to 25 records, even though my issue list is substantially larger.

Recipe:
- Perform some search to identify set of records larger than 25
- In the "current view", select XML
- JIRA displays XML for 25 records.
- At this point, I typically save the file and then import into Excel for additional manipulation.  More on that in a later issue...

Workaround:
- For the page where JIRA displays the 25 records, the URL contains all the parameters.  One of them is tempMax=25.  Changing this value to sufficiently large number and re-loading the page yields a proper export.

Expected/Suggested behavior:
- At a minimum...more clearly document the (highly-questionable) default behavior and workaround
- Vastly preferable...JIRA generates XML for *all* records in the current set, thereby making the XML link work like all the other export links...
fields.summary: XML export limited to 25 records

fields.description: Denote in the header of the comment what type of comment it is ... (e.g., Resolution, Edit, Attachment, Link, etc.)
fields.summary: Issue link/Attachment comments should be displayed in their respective area of the issue OR ...

fields.description:
When linking issues and making comments, it uses the originating issues renderer for comments and posts the comment to both issues.

This can be a problem if you link 2 issues across projects with different renderers.
I will let your imagination figure out what happens.

fields.description:
The title for accesskeys should detect OS and Browser

For Mac browsers the access key should be "Ctrl" and for Opera "Shift + Esc". Alt for the rest

Incorporates JRA-8128
fields.summary: The title for accesskeys should detect OS and Browser

fields.description:
When sending bulk emails from Options & Settings -> Send email,  vertical white space is ignored in the body of the message.  So something like:

Dear all,

Jira will be down for maintatenance

Yours, Jira-admin

Ends up as: Dear all, Jira will be down for maintenance Yours, Jira-admin.

It would be nice if we could send basic plaintext messages, or even better had a good UI for sending HTML mark-up.
fields.summary: Default mime type for Bulk mail from admin

fields.description:
We are get the same error as JRA-4936 under 3.0.2 Professional:
After setting up JIRA on Tomcat5, we go to the URL:
Http://localhost:8080/jira
This redirects us to the setup screen.  After filling the information fields, including our license, clicking Next yields the following message:

"Could not activate indexing: Cannot activate indexing as it is already active."

The path is set to "C:\atlassian\atlassian-jira-professional-3.0.2\indexes", and the folder is created successfully.  We appear to have the newest professional version (#72).  Was the fix in JRA-4936 applied in this version besides Standard?
fields.summary: CLONE -Could not activate indexing on Setup screen

fields.description:
Our customer wants to search for/ filter issues based on their key(s) e.g., SKI-33 AND SKI-66 AND SKI-100.
Further, this query is to be saved like any other filter.

As far as I know, the system field "Key" is not available in the issue navigator. 

Is there a workaround? Please advise!
fields.summary: Search for/ filter several issues based on their keys

fields.description:
Some subtasks are closed, but interpreted and displayed 'Open' in the sub-task list of the view issue screen.

(1) Backup is enclosed.
(2) Have a look at SOL-52 which is the parent issue.
(3) Then check the sub-task (Key SOL-54) on top of the sub-task list which is displayed in both list-modes: All and Open.

I tried re-indexing, but this didn't change anything.

Please advise!
fields.summary: Closed subtasks are interpreted as 'Open'

fields.description:
How can our customer search for "not empty" (custom) fields without searching a particular search term/ phrase? 
The content/ value of the field is irrelevant - we want to search for issues where a particular field is filled in at all.

Our customer's main problem is the following:
How can we filter all Standard Issue Types (or Sub-Task Issue Types), which already have an Original Estimate?

But there are other scenarios (with custom fields involved) where we miss the possibility of searching for fields "that are not empty"
(a) find all issues where there is any "Fixed in Build" (Text Field (< 255 characters) with Free Text Searcher) 
(b) find all issues which already have a "Release Note" (Free Text Field (unlimited text) with Free Text Searcher)
fields.summary: Search/ filter for "not empty" (custom) fields

fields.description:
We use several custom fields of the custom field type Free Text Field (unlimited text) e.g., Release Note, Workaround Description.

When adding those custom fields to the column order , the issue navigator does not display the entire field content, but instead 
cuts the content of the custom fields after the first line and indicates by three dots that there is more text. The same 
behaviour 
applies when you choose the EXCEL-view (e.g., Current Fields). See attachment.

Strangely enough, this entire field content of the system field Description is displayed and transferred to EXCEL as desired.

Please advise!
fields.summary: Content of custom fields is cut after one line in issue navigator and EXCEL-view

fields.description:
I tried to added the following CSV file:

Title,Status,AssignedTo,IssueType,Severity,Priority,OpenedDate,OpenedBy,Resolution,ClosedDate,ClosedBy
Error during multiflight search,Closed,bsiegel,Code Defect,1,1,8/4/2005 0:00,bsiegel,Not Repro,8/4/2005,bsiegel

with the following conf file:
# written by PropertiesConfiguration
# Mon Oct 10 13:26:18 PDT 2005
project.key = BB
project.lead = danblack
project.description = blah
project.url = blah
existingprojectkey = CONFLUENCER
project.name = Bob
importsingleproject = true
importexistingproject = false
mapfromcsv = false
field.OpenedDate = created
field.Severity = customfield_10011
field.OpenedBy = reporter
field.Title = summary
field.IssueType = type
field.AssignedTo = assignee
field.ClosedDate = customfield_10021
field.ClosedBy = customfield_10023
field.Priority = priority
field.Resolution = resolution
field.Status = status
value.Status.Closed = 6
value.Priority.1 = 1
value.Resolution.Not Repro = 5
value.IssueType.Code Defect = 1
user.email.suffix = @exp.com
date.import.format = MM/dd/yyyy
date.fields = OpenedDate
date.fields = ClosedDate
user.extra.fields = customfield_10023

I see the following results in the stdout logs:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.external.ExternalUtils.addOptions(ExternalUtils.java:381)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.importIssues(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:404)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.doImport(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:84)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.importer.impl.ImporterThread.run(ImporterThread.java:21)
fields.summary: CSV Importer hangs when custom field is in incorrect scope
Stack Trace macro

fields.description:
We have problems with screen shots when moving issues to another project. Our end users enters issues to one project. We at IT reviews the issue and moves it to another project and include some additional information. A really good feature is the screen shots, which our end users can attach.
We are now experiencing problems with this functionality:
1. When moving multiple screenshots not all screenshots are moved properly. At least not the thumbnails.
2. When trying to remove those moved issues we are getting an error:
Exception removing issue: com.atlassian.core.AtlassianCoreException: Error in action: com.atlassian.jira.action.issue.IssueDelete@1f96e63, result: null


Our version (which you probably know anyway) is: Professional Edition, Version: 3.3-#96
fields.summary: Moving screenshots does not work properly

fields.description:
People are reporting that indexing is failing in the setup wizard and when reindexing, with the error:

"Could not activate indexing: Error: java.lang.NullPointerException"

In the logs, one sees:

2005-10-07 16:35:49,128 ERROR [jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] !!! issueWriter was null - bad !!!
2005-10-07 16:35:49,128 ERROR [web.action.setup.Setup] Error activating indexing: com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.IndexException: Error: java.lang.NullPointerException
com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.IndexException: Error: java.lang.NullPointerException

...
...

    at org.apache.lucene.store.FSDirectory.getDirectory(FSDirectory.java:102)
    at org.apache.lucene.store.FSDirectory.getDirectory(FSDirectory.java:83)

fields.summary: NullPointerException when setting up indexing (lock directory permission problems)

fields.description:
Hi,

Okay, now I'm not sure on this, but I think I may have a bug.

I was doing some work with in confluence and it appeared the jiraissues macro wasn't displaying the correct fields. I thought it was something wrong with the URL I was invoking, but in the end found it was the actual RSS feed which was displaying empy fields. This seems to occur both from confluence and also when I am logged in using JIRA. You should be able to verify this by having a look at the JIRA installation for the ABIF project located here: "http://jira.abif.org/jira".

Originally I thought it might be a permissions thing, but it appears some fields are being populated (like the issue status) but that is all. Any help or thoughts would be appreciated.

Cheers,

David Levy
fields.summary: RSS feed seems to be broken

Look through and commit if possible patches for perforce job linking in PERF-62

fields.description:
The umpteenth person has just asked why they can't search for versions/components, and told that you need to pick a project first. Clearly we have a UI problem.

Now we have parts of the search interface hidden in tabs, how about displaying a grayed-out "Versions/Components" tab, with a rollover or popup-when-clicked explaining that a project needs to be selected? The same thing could be done with a 'Custom fields' tab.
fields.summary: UI improvement: make components/versions visible but disabled on search page
